entry.et: Middle English yisterday, from Old English giestran dæg, from giestran yesterday + dæg day; akin to Old High German gestaron yesterday, Latin heri, Greek chthes

def.dt: :on the day last past :on the day preceding today
:at a time not long past :only a short time ago I wasn't born yesterday
:the day last past :the day next before the present
